What is the purpose of the `getinitialcurrencystate` command in Verus?

The `getinitialcurrencystate` command in Verus is used to retrieve the initial state of a currency, including its flags, currency ID, reserve currencies, initial supply, emitted coins, and current supply. It also provides information about the currency's conversion rates, fees, and other relevant details.

#### Arguments:
```
  "name"          (string, required) name or chain ID of the chain to get the export transactions for
```
#### Result:
```json
{
 "flags": n,           (hex) flags for the currency
 "currencyid": "xxxx",      (text) i-address of the currency ID
 "reservecurrencies": [
  {
		 "currencyid": "xxxx",    (text) i-address of the currency ID
		 "weight": n,         (numeric) The weight of this currence
		 "reserves": xxx.xxxxxxxx,  (numeric) The initial amount of this currency in reserve
		 "priceinreserve": n     (numeric) The initial conversion rate of this reserve currency
  }
 ],
 "initialsupply" : xxx.xxxxxxxx, (numeric) The initial supply of this currency
 "emitted" : xxx.xxxxxxx,     (numeric) The currently emitted coins of this currency
 "supply" : xxx.xxxxxxxx,     (numeric) The current supply of this currency
 "currencies": {
  "xxxx": {           (text) i-address of the currency ID
 	 "reservein": xxx.xxxxxxxx,   
 	 "nativein": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "reserveout": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "lastconversionprice": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "viaconversionprice": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "fees": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "conversionfees": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
   "priorweights": xxx.xxxxxxxx
  },{
   ...
  },
  "primarycurrencyfees": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "primarycurrencyconversionfees": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "primarycurrencyout": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "preconvertedout": xxx.xxxxxxx
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getinitialcurrencystate name
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getinitialcurrencystate", "params": [name] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getlastimportfrom "systemname"`
Returns the last import from a specific originating system.
What information does the `getinitialcurrencystate` command return?

The `getinitialcurrencystate` command returns a JSON object with the following information:

* `flags`: hexadecimal flags for the currency
* `currencyid`: the i-address of the currency ID
* `reservecurrencies`: an array of reserve currencies, including their IDs, weights, initial reserve amounts, and initial conversion rates
* `initialsupply`: the initial supply of the currency
* `emitted`: the currently emitted coins of the currency
* `supply`: the current supply of the currency
* `currencies`: an object with detailed information about each currency, including reserve and native amounts, conversion prices, fees, and prior weights
* Additional fields for primary currency fees, conversion fees, and output amounts

#### Arguments:
```
  "name"          (string, required) name or chain ID of the chain to get the export transactions for
```
#### Result:
```json
{
 "flags": n,           (hex) flags for the currency
 "currencyid": "xxxx",      (text) i-address of the currency ID
 "reservecurrencies": [
  {
		 "currencyid": "xxxx",    (text) i-address of the currency ID
		 "weight": n,         (numeric) The weight of this currence
		 "reserves": xxx.xxxxxxxx,  (numeric) The initial amount of this currency in reserve
		 "priceinreserve": n     (numeric) The initial conversion rate of this reserve currency
  }
 ],
 "initialsupply" : xxx.xxxxxxxx, (numeric) The initial supply of this currency
 "emitted" : xxx.xxxxxxx,     (numeric) The currently emitted coins of this currency
 "supply" : xxx.xxxxxxxx,     (numeric) The current supply of this currency
 "currencies": {
  "xxxx": {           (text) i-address of the currency ID
 	 "reservein": xxx.xxxxxxxx,   
 	 "nativein": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "reserveout": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "lastconversionprice": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "viaconversionprice": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "fees": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
 	 "conversionfees": xxx.xxxxxxxx,
   "priorweights": xxx.xxxxxxxx
  },{
   ...
  },
  "primarycurrencyfees": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "primarycurrencyconversionfees": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "primarycurrencyout": xxx.xxxxxxx,
  "preconvertedout": xxx.xxxxxxx
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getinitialcurrencystate name
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getinitialcurrencystate", "params": [name] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

Returns the last import from a specific originating system.
How can I use the `getinitialcurrencystate` command in Verus?

You can use the `getinitialcurrencystate` command in Verus by running the following command in the terminal:
```
verus getinitialcurrencystate <name>
```
Replace `<name>` with the name or chain ID of the currency you want to retrieve the initial state for.

Alternatively, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON RPC request to the Verus node:
```bash
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getinitialcurrencystate", "params": [name] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `<name>` with the name or chain ID of the currency, and `<myusername>` with your Verus node username.

#### Arguments:
```
  "name"          (string, required) name or chain ID of the chain to get the export transactions for
```
#### Result:
